New Records: India's batting coach Vikram Rathour agreed that 'it was a challenging wicket'
Key Match Events: Arshdeep Singh dismissed both openers in his second over
Sharma eventually retired hurt, holding his shoulder
India beat Ireland by eight wickets
Post-Match Reflections: Ireland’s coach Heinrich Malan afterwards. ‘When you look at T20 cricket you want to see runs, and boundaries, don’t you?’
Miscellaneous Highlights: The top score is Rohit Sharma’s 52, off 37 balls
Teams are making the same sort of Victorian scores they were running up here in 1844
The ball reared and kicked and jagged and spat and seamed and stopped
Others: The ICC must be worried that the Federal Trade Commission is going to bring an advertising standards case against it if the cricket carries on like this
